TextBlock.Text: <color=lightblue>Enji</color>: I've gathered enough <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color> crystals here on <color=orange>Frost Car</color>. I've also managed to finally get my hands on one of the larger crystals from the <color=orange>core</color>.

The smaller crystals are being refined on Locomocean and will be used as the main source of power for the train. Honestly, everyone saying that Ghost Matter can be an extremely volatile substance hasn't really seemed to consider the industrial applications of the stuff.

The larger crystal is also being taken to <color=orange>Locomocean</color>, but it will instead be used for a new <color=orange>Advanced Warp Core</color> I have been designing to surpass our current warp technology.
I find it strange that we have been using the same old tech for thousands of years. It's as old as the tales of <color=orange>Escall's Clan</color>.
I wonder what <color=orange>Annona</color> would think of my design...
As I don't want to jeopardize my success by falling to my death, I've decided to block off entry to the core.
I won't be needing to go back down, but I will eventually need to come back here for the smaller crystals. Entropy and all that it entails, you know how it is.

<color=orange>Update</color>: I had to go back... I needed an even bigger crystal. For future reference, <color=orange>the first turn after entering</color> the ice tunnels leads directly to the <color=orange>core</color>. Come to think of it, the tunnels blocked by <color=lightblue>Ghost Matter</color> seem to be the most direct route to it.
